game-hours: 86.1
review: I was going to wait until I hit 100 total hours of play time, but I just could not wait! This game went Free To Play a while back, and with that decision, brought many players who were not serious about the game and just wanted a little game to play for a little while. I am not discouraging such behaviour, but Valve decided that they were no longer making money from game sales, so they added microtransactions. What a distasteful day. They added cosmetic items, such as hats, in the Sniper vs Spy update. It went to hell from there. Team Fortress 2 has become a game of trading hats and rarely weapons. Yes the game is still very fun. Yes the hats are kind of amusing. But I can not stree to you enough, there are few things worse than a kid flooding the chat menu with "Deals" on his hats and cosmetics, while everyone else is playing the game. One of the most entertaining features of this game is doing the conga! After a recent update, an item was released. An item to unify. An item to long live in players' hearts. This item is the conga! You can initiate the conga and have everyone on the server join in! You can conga for hours and just have fun, no violence! Bottom line, this game is a shooter, nothing less, and a very balanced shooter at that. The classes are all very balanced and need each other to work together. This game is full of Free to Players who are here for the sole intention of trading, that is unfortunate, but the game is extremely fun. Why are you even reading this?? This game is free! Spend 100's of hours FOR FREE!!!

review: This game... This ing game... Alright. Let me tell ya a little story. Long ago, nine brave warriors joined together to fight... themselves... in blue clothing... And this fight went on for a pretty ing long time. Like, a lot longer than people expected. Then some hats happened, Spies became unkillable, a whole bunch of .... Anyway, the point is: this game is really ing fun. Balanced (for the most part), funny, great story (if you don't mind reading), and fun with friends. But don't go into this thinking it's just another FPS. This game exaggerates everything. You'll need to learn some odd game mechanics that you don't see that often. Things like rocketjumping, stair stabbing and a whole bunch of other stuf that might make you question this game, but once you gt the hang of it, you'll have a great time. And there's no pay to win. You can find every weapon in the game with just a little bit of time. So, if you don't believe me when I say this game is amazing... I mean... cmon, bro.... You can beat people with a ing fish. Why the hell wouldn't you want to do that. Get this game. 8/8 gr8 m8

review: Best Game Eveeeeeeeeeeeeeer!!!!!!!!!!
game-hours: 26.8
review: This game is amazing, although the classes/charcters is not that realistic and quiet cartoonish, it still has the guts to blow your mind. There are 9 classes in the game.Scout, Soldier, Pyro, Demoman, Heavy, Engineer, Medic, Sniper and Spy. ..Scout.. Primary wepon: Shotgun Secondary wepon: Pistol Melee wepon: Bat HP: 125 You may be thinking, the scout has horrible wepons and not that much HP. Well then, you are wrong. What's special about the scout is that he can run incredibly fast. So fast in fact he is quiet hard to shoot him down and he can also do a double jump to get to the hard to reach places. ..Soldier.. Primary wepon: Rocket launcher Secondary wepon: Shotgun Melee wepon: Shovel HP: 200 The Soldier is very strong but weak on his accuracy. His Rocket launcher is around like about a 2 hit kill. The best thing about the soldier is the rocket jump. The rocket jump will make you go flying in the sky having a chace to escape or kill everyone around you. Keep in mind on his favourite word.....MAGGOTS. ..Pyro.. Primary wepon: Flamethrower Secondary wepon: Shotgun Melee wepon: Axe HP: 175 The Pyro has a mental disability called schizophrenia. Schizophrenia is a serious brain disorder that distorts the way a person thinks, acts, expresses emotions, perceives reality, and relates to others. People with schizophrenia -- the most chronic and disabling of the major mental illnesses -- often have problems functioning in society, at work, at school, and in relationships. Schizophrenia can leave its sufferer frightened and withdrawn. It is a life-long disease that cannot be cured but usually can be controlled with proper treatment. His Flamethrower can kill you in an instant so run away if his flamethrower is aming at you. ..Demoman.. Primary wepon: Grenade launcher Secondary wepon: Stickybomb launcher Melee wepon: Beer Bottle HP: 175 Demoman is an explosives expert and always gets drunk. He is hard to use but if you can get the use of him, you would probably be on a killing spree. If someone is chasing you and you find yourself near the wall, use the grenade launcher to shoot the wall so the grenade will bounce off and hit right at 'em. Stickybonbs are extremly strong, make traps, trick players and alot more ideas that can send the players to their grave. ..Heavy.. Primary wepon: Miningun Secondary wepon: Shotgun Melee wepon: Fists HP: 300 Lets just say he is completley diffrent from the scout. He has the highest HP out of all the other classes and he called his Miningun the name Sasha. His Miningun can really harm the players if you are close to them. ..Engineer.. Primary wepon: Shotgun Secondary wepon: Pistol Melee wepon: Wrench HP: 125 The engineer builds a sentry gun, dispenser, teleporter entrance and teleporter exit. You do not want to mess with the engineer's sentry. A sentry gun can hold 2 mininguns and a 3X3 rocket launcher. It can kill you in an instant if you go near it. A dispenser is very helpful for you and your team (especially when there is no medic). A dispenser re-fills your teammates ammo and re-fills their HP. Teleporters can take your teammates to your place much quicker than just walking there. ..Medic.. Primary wepon: Styringe gun Secondary wepon: Medi gun Melee wepon: Bone saw HP: 150 The medic was once a doctor in Germany who lost his medical license for taking out the patient's full skeleton instead of his skull, during an operation. He is now a crazy german scientist working in man CO. ..Sniper.. Primary wepon: Sniper Rifle Secondary wepon :SMG Melee wepon: Kuriki HP: 125 An austrailian bogan who's dad has been calling him a crazed gunman instead of an assasin. The sniper is quiet strong when you can't see him and his melee wepon will make you bleed badly. ..Spy.. Primary wepon: Revolver Secondary wepon: Sapper Gadget #1: Disguise Gadget #2: Invis watch Melee wepon: Knife HP: 125 That backstabber is really stealthy. He can turn invisible without you recognising and backstab you easily. He can breach defences easily, for example, if there is a sentry gun defending, you can use the sapper to take them down giving support for your other team to attack. The enemies can be fooled by him by putting on a disguise and backstabbing them. Use the revolver only if one of the enemies saw you. This is my breif explinatoin about and I truly recommend this game for everyone.

game-hours: 212.9

game-hours: 1309.4
review: Team Fortress 2 is one of those games where you begin to play it, and you realize that it's something special, it's not like another Fps. To be honest, I thought that tf2 was just another game, I didn't have any idea it was going to be one of the best games I'd ever play. After 650 hours, I can say it truly is something marvelous. -Design: 10/10 Everything about Tf2 is designed to be a game of balance. Wheter you just started playing, or have unusuals, you will always be challanged by someone, or a team, that is superior to you. The focus on classes, and their unique contribution to the team adds a whole new playing ground for skill sets. The classes are meant to not only incourage teamwork, but to eliminate repetition and boredom. If you get tired of healing your heavies, you can go build a freakin' sentry gun. -Gameplay 10/10 I mean come on. Tf2 is so far off the scale of fun that it's kinda ridiculous to give it a 10. The game never gets old! It's amazing. The entire game is built on variety, you can play different gamemodes, different classes, different servers, nothing is gets to the point where you just don't want to play it anymore. If there ever has been an example of a player-made game, this is one. Team Fortress has a TOTALLY unique economy, not like a small one, like an established, working, reliable (except for 6 ref keys) , and enjoyable economy. And although some would disagree with me, I think that team work is a big part of the game. Even if you have one player who dominates the entire server, he can be overwhelmed by an organized group of F2ps. This is why you got a 10 Tf2. *Applause*. -Value 8/10 The reason Team Fortress 2 gets an 8 for value is because of the following : Yes, you can spend NO money on the game period. But if you are serious about the game, and want to trade, you MUST spend money. Although the game is playable without being premium, if you get serious it becomes nearly impossible to be Free to Play. The reasons being, 1. Only one backpack page, 2. not finding premium items, 3. no steam trading, etc. If you are self-disciplined, you might get to be premium by buying a $0.49 item. You don't have to spend anymore than that to become premium, but you probably will. Once it sets in that you're broke, you might be tempted to buy a key or two. and Then mabye that special hat you wanted. So it is Free to Play, but not in a practical way. -Sounds/Security 10/10 The soundtrack is some ways makes Tf2 what it is. That main menu music is so iconic that if you were to remove it, it would dramatically change the game. The rude, hilarious comments of your rag-tag team of mercenaries adds part of the comedy element. The taunts, fantastic. Even the hilariously named items, which I consider part of this group, add a huge part to the game. Now to security, Valve has done quite a job on securing the game, and protecting it. To physically "hack" into the game requires bypassing several well-designed safety protocols such as VAC. The one flaw would have to be the power private servers are given. Because the game is so open ended on the modding community, servers can change the game in ways which make it a negative experience, they can run invasive ads, add Pay2Win ranks, and even create things which are harmful to your PC. Other than that, valve has done a great job. -Overall 10/10 "Team Fortress 2 has got something no other game has, it has a design which I don't think will ever need changing, It will never need an overhaul, because it's perfect." -James

game-hours: 554.5
review: Team Fortress 2 is a twist to the multiplayer FPS games, as each character as some kind of special skill to their advantage. The game has the simple capture the flag and king of the hill gamemodes, it also has new gamemodes that no other FPS multiplayer game has or uses. These new gamemodes are Terriotorial control, Payload, Payload races, special delivery and the Mann vs. Machine mode. The weapons have four ways of being obtained which helps players get better, the first way is it being randomly dropped or given in Mann-up mode for Mann vs. Machine, the other two are buying the items or opening crates. This game has its ups and downs, mostly with the spy class as its very hard to be sneaky with pyros around or the fact that the uber charge is great in a choke point. This game's best part is finding that perfect class or weapon that really helps you in the long run. This game is a 10/10, the only problem I have is when players that are medics completly ignore you when you need them the most.

game-hours: 401.8
review: This game is amazing. I had been wanting to play this for the longest time. It was actually the main reason why I made a Steam account. I became a huge fan immediately. This game is very different from the FPS games you see today, aside from the cartoonish style. There are nine classes to choose from and when you begin to play, there is an optional tutorial for each class. There is also an offline practice mode, which is great if you want to try each class and find out which one suits you best. I love the humor and the style. This game is very unique. I'm an old school shooter fan, especially id Software's games, and it really appeals to me. If you're sick of modern shooters (*cough* Call of Duty *cough cough*), I'm sure you'll enjoy TF2.

review: What can I say, it's a fun game. If your a fan of FPS or like games where you can make your character look fabulous, then this is a game for you. game-hours: 1306.5
review: TF2 is, to put it boldly, the most fun multiplayer FPS on Steam, and probably on PC. Call of Duty it isn't, and that's a good thing. Team Fortress 2 is a game where you choose from one of 9 different classes, all of which are expertly balanced and offer a playstyle for everybody, and try to complete an objective with your team. Teamwork is extremely important here, and those who just want to run around and do their own thing, trying to get as many kills as possible, won't last very long. Every class has a weakness that can be covered by another class, and when the right combination of players get together, magic can happen. There is no reason for you not to play this game, especially since it's free.

game-hours: 1269.3
review: Well, there's a lot to say, both negative and positive. I honestly won't be able to fill in all my thoughts about the game in this tiny little recommendation but I will summarize some issues: While the weapons and items seemed fun and innocent at first, they eventually brought in much unbalance and ego inflation from players. The positive side though is that the community made items that go into the game help get the creator noticed (and I assume they get some revenue). Another issue I have is that the game always had a comical style to it, but it seems over the years it's gone overboard. The game had a balance between serious and humor, but now it's complete insanity. Everything is pretty much about humor and being "out there". Some will take this good or bad, for me, maybe I just got used to how it use to be. As for the F2P topic, I must give Valve credit for being able to pull it off so well, even if I do hate the Mann Co. Store will all my passion. I really have tried to leave this game due to some of the reasons mentioned above, but something keeps making me come back. I guess somehow through all the bloated additions, I still find the thing that made TF2 for me, what made it fun. So in the end, it's a harmless and fun game, and liking it doesn't make you a bad person.

review: i like this game
game-hours: 532.5
review: Class-based fps shooter with its own economy. You can also ride bumper cars in hell and shoot big flying eyeballs and wizards. Has multiple classes for multiple playstyles. Spy - Stealthy, you can act as a double agent by disguising as someone in the enemy team. Can also turn invisible for a limited amount of time. If set on fire he remains invisible, but you can see the fire. Scout - Runs fast. You can use this to your advantage in a battle. And, you can scout ahead. No-one does that, though. Heavy - Armed with a minigun and a lot of health. He is not your big friendly bear. Medic - Can heal other players. Has an ubercharge counter, it fills up by healing people - even faster if you heal more injured ones. When the ubercharge is activated he shall remain invincible until the ubercharge goes back to 0% Demoman - Demolitions expert. Can setup traps and take out sentries. Engineer - Can engineer various deadly contraptions that support his team, but do the opposite for the enemies. Pyro - Pyromaniac. I would recommend this for beginners. I don't mean to offend pyro mains, but all you have to do is hold mouse 1. Comes equiped with a flamethrower. Can unlock a flare gun to inflame people from a distance. Sniper - Has a sniper. Is a sniper. Aiming down your sight long enough charges the gun to instantly kill people if he headshots them. Is vulnerable to spies. Soldier - Armed with a rocket launcher. Has abilities to rocket jump effectively getting him point to point quickly.
game-hours: 13.4

game-hours: 1058.0
review: Besides being addictive, with several mods, different classes, is the best F2P game I've ever played.
game-hours: 363.8
review: Definitely in my Top 5 FPS. For a game that was made in 2007, the graphics will blow you away. The gameplay is simple and there's always people online (for you midnight gamers.) It has an original and complex stroyline and 8 hilariously fun and action-packed gamemodes. The concept of choosing from 9 different classes is original and there's something special about each class. TF2 also has a sick sense of humor so that you just can't help but laugh when you watch a scout get blown up by a rocket or watch a demoman get sniped. The game is not a Pay2Win which is a definite plus. Your classes are also EXTREMELY customizable with hats. Lots and lots of hats. I give this game 5/5 stars. I recommend this game to casual and hardcore gamers alike.

review: If there is anything to Team Fortress 2 is how impressive and repeatative it is for new players and veterans at this game. People always come back for a little more than what they intentionally wanted from a free game, and it delivers. Valve has created a game based on the principles of character custimization, user interface, and profittable material, all in the name of the user. No other game so far has given this amount of freedom to anyone, and has surpassed expectations of what games could become. And while the game lacks detailed maps and graphics expected from newer games today, it is important to realize that the story, mechanics, and community of a game matter much more than some fancy particle effects, such as Starcraft 1 compared to CoD series. I highly recommend supporting community made content and play this with your friends. If there is anyone who has never heard of Steam or TF2, they should absolutly try this first. Enjoy this great game.

game-hours: 1384.5
review: Greatest game of all time.
game-hours: 1224.9
review: Team Fortress 2 is a great game, for a number of reasons: It receives constant free updates, and features and a quick, efficient matchmaking system. It is free to play, but is not pay to win; most of the items on the store are cosmetic only. Weapons can be purchased, but are either a) cosmetic re-skins of other weapons, and if not, are b) all available by a random drop system through gameplay. Almost all collectable weapons are side-grades to the defaults. It features a plethora of game modes, all of which are well balanced/designed, have dedicated servers for, and are played frequently by large numbers of people. Some examples would include the traditional king of the hill and capture the flag, but others are unique to Team Fortress; these would include payload, attack/defence, and melee only. Other unofficial game modes are present as well, with numerous servers supporting them; skiing and rocket jumping servers are examples. It features nine different classes, all of which have been extensively tested and are fun to play. Each class also has numerous loadout options which can drastically alter the function of it. There is a class suited to each kind of playstyle, and switching to a different class sometimes feels like playing a completely different game! Each has its own purpose, advantages and disadvantages. While some classes have steeper learning curves, TF2 is in no way discouraging towards new players; it has tutorials, a spectator feature for watching live matches, and features some classes that are easier to get used to for new players, such as the Medic and Soldier. That said, there is no skill ceiling either; one can spend countless hours perfecting their aim as Sniper, learning how to blend in as Spy, and ruwining enemies from close range as Scout. It is truely a team based game; it is impossible for a team to win, or to be shut down, by one powerhouse player. As mentioned previously, each class has its strengths and weaknesses, and must work with other members to achieve victory. It's okay if you're not a player with fast reflexes; strategy is just as if not more important than skill in this game. It also features a co-operative game mode, called Mann vs. Machine, where players fight against computer generated bots in a series of waves. This mode has also been worked on abundantly; one could spend hours devising strategies and loadouts for co-op play. It features a working economy! Items can be crafted, bought, and sold, for in game currency (metal) or even real world money, through the Steam Market and offical TF2 trading websites. The economy is extensive enough that some players only partake in trading, although using the economy is in no way mandatory for playing the game as a shooter. Overall, this is an incredibly complex but astoundingly inviting game. It almost surpasses the tradtional title of "shooter" because of its depth, focus on strategy and real time economy. 10/10

review: Unlike common FPS games, Team Fortress 2 brings a more comedic and playful environment to players and fans. The unrealisticness allows for different features not possible in real life such as explosive jumping, double jumping, building motion sensored sentries just by repeatedly hitting it with a wrench, becoming invincible and other methods to help massacre the opposing team. Along with playing the game, there is more to just killing others to win. To shame your enemies and please your now-dead employers (Redmond and Blutarch Mann), help capture a paper-spilling briefcase full of information, take control of points, or explode the enemy base. Different characters & different weapons allow you to fit your playing style whether it'd be towards mobility, heavy damage, or even an assisting distraction. Overall, the game is not limited to one form of gameplay, and you are likely to find ways to make it more enjoyable whether it'd be in vanilla game modes, new weapons, modded servers, or even hats!

game-hours: 1970.0
review: Team Fortress 2 is a class-based shooter filled with personality and fun that can keep you entertained for ages. There are nine classes to choose from that fit any play style or situation that may be throw at you. These class are the: Scout, Soldier, Pyro, Demoman, Heavy, Engineer, Medic, Sniper and Spy. The Scout is a fast paced, double jumping class featuring a Scatter Gun that is deadly up-close. The Soldier (my favourite) is given a rocket launcher and, to compensate for his slow movement, has the ability to rocket jump which can propel him faster and further than any class could dream of going. The Pyro is a mysterious being that has a deep love for fire and burning things and is given a flame thrower to do just that. The Demoman is a 'black, Scottish cyclops' who specialises in explosives wielding a stickybomb launcher that can be fired at any surface to attach remotely detonated explosives to surprise enemies. He also has the ability to turn into a 'demoknight', sporting a sword and shield that lets him charge at his enemies and take their heads. Next is the Heavy. This slow talking Russian is armed with 'Sasha', a incredibly large minigun capable of destroying anything that comes near it. Because of this, the Heavy moves very slowly and, because of his... stature, is an big target for anyone. The Heavy is also the tank of the classes featuring the largest health pool in the game. The Engineer is the brains of the group. He has the ability to build buildings such as sentries, dispensers and teleporters which helps out his team in defending (or attacking) areas. The Medic is the healer of the group, wielding a medigun instead of actual medical knowledge. He is able to heal his targeted team mate and give them overheal so they may sustain more damage. His role is to keep everyone alive and, if he's been healing for long enough, give them an Ubercharge which grants him and his heal target 8 seconds of invulnerability. The Sniper is fairly standard class in most shooters but TF2 has thrown a twist on the class. His sniper rifle features a modification which allows for higher damage the longer the user is scoped in. Aim for the head when sniping, otherwise the sniper rifle will do a third of the damage. The Spy is the stealth class, favouring invisibility and disguises to avoid confrontation and then to kill targets instantly with his knife's backstab. He is also able to sap enemy Engineer's buildings which disables and eventually destroys them. Constantly updating, TF2 has a growing community which means you will always find a match or someone to trade with. Whether it be in game or on one of the community made trade websites, someone out their wants your hats. It's free and fun, why wouldn't you try it?

game-hours: 2086.9
review: Octoberfest is the world's largest fair held annually in Munich, Bavaria, Germany. It is a 16-day festival running from late September to the first weekend in October with more than 6 million people from around the world attending the event every year. To the locals, it is not called Oktoberfest, but "die Wies'n", after the colloquial name of the fairgrounds (Theresienwiese) themselves. The Oktoberfest is an important part of Bavarian culture, having been held since 1810. Other cities across the world also hold Oktoberfest celebrations, modeled after the original Munich event. The Munich Oktoberfest originally took place during the sixteen days up to, and including, the first Sunday in October. In 1994, the schedule was modified in response to German reunification so that if the first Sunday in October falls on the 1st or 2nd, then the festival would go on until October 3 (German Unity Day). Thus, the festival is now 17 days when the first Sunday is October 2 and 18 days when it is October 1. In 2010, the festival lasted until the first Monday in October, to mark the anniversary of the event. The festival is held in an area named the Theresienwiese (field, or meadow, of Therese), often called Wiesn for short, located near Munich's center. Large quantities of Oktoberfest Beer are consumed, with almost 7 million litres served during the 16 day festival in 2007. Visitors may also enjoy a wide variety of traditional food such as Hendl (roast chicken), Schweinebraten (roast pork), Schweinshaxe (grilled ham hock), Steckerlfisch (grilled fish on a stick), Wrstl (sausages) along with Brezen (pretzel), Kndel (potato or bread dumplings), Ksesptzle (cheese noodles), Reiberdatschi (potato pancakes), Sauerkraut or Rotkohl/Blaukraut (red cabbage) along with such Bavarian delicacies as Obatzda (a spiced cheese-butter spread) and Weisswurst (a white sausage).

Be the Demoman, and blow everything and everyone up all the way to hell with all manner of explosives. review: A gripping tale of intrigue, romance, betrayal, friendship, and the power of love. When men and women are torn down by the ills of the world, their inner selves bared stark naked to the light of day, to whom can they look for the strength to carry on? The Heavy. The Heavy, a man of great talent and strength, carries the burdens of all on his massive, rippling back. The guns he chooses are not selected based on firepower, but rather their ability to convey that which words cannot. Every shot fired from the chambers of his minigun cleaves through the  and inanity that surrounds our every day existence in order to drive home the truths that no other people are willing to admit. He bears this gun without complaint, uttering few words as he treks across the badlands of the American Southwest and the granaries of the nation's heartland. Though many stand in his way, he will not end his quest to carry truth and justice to all who need him. Team Fortress 2.

review: Team Fortress 2 is literally my favorite shooter of all time. It's easier to understand than most first person shooters, such as Call of Duty and Battlefield. You only need to spend around 50 cents to get Premium. I've known about this game since 2008, but never bothered to pick it up until very late 2011. Now I'm loving it and have nearly 2000 hours on record. The graphics are cartoony but detailed, there are over 70 weapons and 200 hats to find and wear, I highly recommend this game to any Steam user. That means you, the one reading this long review!

review: This was my first game on Steam and yes I got it free. It's a even paced multiplayer game that is fairly easy to learn and is so much fun to play with friends. I mostly only play during class assignments with my college friends, and it's a great way to blow off steam. The classes are great, but sometimes it's difficult for someone who is just starting to play the game to learn by themselves. And of course theres the weapons and hats. That's probably my favourite part of the game is getting weapons and hats. I'd rate myself as a slightly above average skill level player, but it's hard to do a lot if you only have default weapons for some classes. My only complaint would be that I'd love for there to be an easier way to get weapons without shelling out money in the store.

review: Team Fortress 2 is a complicatingly simple game. It is easy to get into, and will quickly become an addiction with finding new and fancier weapons, playing this class I've never tried before. You're rockin' pubs, showin' who's boss, when you get a domination. Upon respawn, you get a new item. The Ghastly Gibus? A hat? You put it on. And at that second, you are now one with TF2. You will try to leave it to play with friends, only to find yourself playing again and again. Trading? A whole new world is opened to you. You buy premium and quickly find yourselve spening hours infront of spreadsheets, pricelists, examples of completed trades, must, make, profit. Your entire life is now wondering what hat would look best on sniper, or how to make enough metal to get that strange you want. And it's a wonderful feeling completing a trade and finding your new item snuggled securely in your backpack. 0/10 Just plain awful ruined my life

game-hours: 1761.1
review: This game is honestly one of the best I've ever played. I have never been a Valve fanboy (although I did like playing Portal) but this game is just...flawless. There's a reason that so many people love this game and so many people reccomned this to their friends. The art style is simultaneously hilarious and intriguing, the characters are hilarious and interesting, the game modes are fun, and the players (on the most part) are good gaming buddies. Originality: 9/10 I really do appreciate the fact that the TF2 devs decided to sway from the whole TDM/DM game modes and decided to add some of their own twists on games (Payload and CtF). Graphics/Art Syle: 10/10 There's not much to say besides you feel like you're playing a game inside of a comic book. The lighting is superb, the characters are rendered well, and the maps themselves are flawless (although occasionally you might run into a stray hitbox). Gameplay: 9/10 There is occasional lag and occasional "Connection Problem *insert timer before you get kicked off*", and that's the only reason this isn't a ten. However, if you have a good internet connection (I don't) and/or a good gaming computer (I don't) you might not have these problems. Community: 8/10 The TF2 community is pretty decent. They accept noobs and some (awesome) players even help introduce them to the games. However, this game has a trading mechanic that is wonderful for trollers/scammers, and there are always the jerks in game who exploit glitches, and pros who join in noob matches just to proove their dominance in online gaming. However, most games have these kinds of people and I don't think points should be deducted from the game just because of few asshats. Price: 11/10 I mean its free. Why are you even reading this? Just download the game and play it, and, while you're at it, go ahead and shoot me a friend request. :)

game-hours: 252.7
review: Team Fortress 2, the Orange Box hit by Valve from '07. Ya know, with most games it's good for a couple years, then it and the community itself dies down a bit; I remember the Guncraft beta servers were almost always full! For the final version, it's difficult to find a good server with over zero players logged in. Team Fortress 2 is different. Team Fortress 2 is five, going on six years old yet billions still play. It may be running on a slightly-outdated engine, but the cartoonish feel compensates for that; the gameplay is both entertaining and makes you want to punch a hole through your monitor, especially with those god forsaken Scouts. Overall, this game is a definate 11 out of 10, and I don't know about you, but I see myself playing every day for the forseeable future.

game-hours: 460.8
review: This game is great. Seriously. Even if you never played an FPS, you still need to play it. TF2 involves 2 teams (RED and BLU) trying to accomplish an objective. There are 9 classes to choose from, and they all play completely differently from each other. For example, the Scout is incredibly fast, but he has low HP. The Heavy is the opposite: he's the slowest class in the game, but he has a whopping 300 health. The classes counter each other nicely: are Spies backstabbing your team and easily taking down your defenses? Get some Pyros on your team to blast them away with their flamethrowers, getting rid of their disguises and invisibility. The game also has a lot of unlockable items. There are weapons that have slightly different stats than the orignals: for example, the Heavy's Brass Beast minigun does more damage than the stock minigun, but has a slower spin-up time and lowers your move speed more when spun up. There are also weapons that completely change how a class works: the Sniper's Huntsman replaces the sniper rifle with a bow that is best suited for medium-range fights. The game also has a TON of hats: these don't change any stats, but they make your classes look as swagtastic as possible. There's also a great trading system. The unoffical currencies of trading are scrap metal, crate keys, and earbuds: it's weird, but it's easy enough to get rich-ish. Overall, I'd recomend TF2 to anyone who likes video games. Also, it's free.

game-hours: 492.3
review: Team Fortress 2 is a deep and artistic story driven FPAE ( First Person Artistic Experience ) that is a must play for all. What starts as a typical military story about a young boy named NOGAMES forced into a war against his will evolves into a dramatic well paced plot involving a hat conspiracy and overt religious themes. I was literaly left in tears at the twist ending. Check this game out if you want a truly well written game that isn't afraid to delve into the controversial relationship human beings have with hats and religion. The only fault this game has is that it falls apart midway into the series when a new character named Gaben is introduced and starts to take the light away from the more developed characters like Robin. Also the lead character NOGAMES never truly matures although this is partially intended to represent the human condition of hats. Either way this is a unique game and if you're not afraid to try something new and different then play TF2.

game-hours: 377.3
review: Hat Simulator 2014 is a game about collecting hats, crafting hats, finding hats, unboxing hats, and trading hats. The game has a very complex algorithm for determining which hat you will find, based on choices you have made in the game. The game also includes minigames to play while you wait to recieve a hat, such as killing other players, pushing carts arounds, playing music over the mic, etc. I give this game an overall rating of 7.5 stars out of 2 thumbs up.
game-hours: 239.8
review: This game is totally wicked. Play it.
game-hours: 51.5
review: Team-based first person shooter with many gamemodes. TF2 convinces with solid gameplay and a strong focus on teamplay, watch each others back (literally... dat spy...), with clear roles given, you gotta know your place. Graphicly its ok, unfortunatly the german players are limited to low violence kiddy version for whatever reason (no matter how old the actual user is). The game should run on most machines, even if its 6 years old. The game modes are all enjoyable, and require different stragies of the teams. Gameplaywise the most annoying thing for beginners is probably getting killed by spies, until you start shooting everyone once in a while to make sure its really your team. The payment model is tricky though, first it seems very fair to play without paying anything, but then you realize that your backpack is way to limited to receive f2p-drops, and its hard to craft (+ limited receipes as non-premium). So getting the weapons you want is very unlikley. Unlike Dota 2 items which are cosmetic only, this items actually have stats and some change the way to play a class significantly. I recommend checking the game out if you are a fan of the genre, and then maybe spending <2$ to get premium status, that should give you enough drops and backpack space to enjoy the game for a longer time (until you decide if you want to spent more money, im not there yet). In the end its F2P, so just go for it. 'nuff said.

review: Best, balanced and most original skill team based E-sport of all time. It is simply for casual players who couldn't give a  and are just in it for the fun. review: The core game is fine, it's not P2W, the most important items are dropped via achievements, and the stock items are in many cases the best anyways. What for me destroys the game is the focus on hats or general cosmetic items. For the most part of the community and Valve now, it's no longer about the gameplay. It really is for many players just the Hat Simulator #1, and that's just not my thing. I recommend the game regardless, because although the game can be better if they would focus more on the gameplay, it's a solid shooter with a good class system and a nice art style.

game-hours: 1561.5
review: For about three years now, I've been a long-time collector of items in Team Fortress 2, trying to stay on top of new stuff when it comes out. And as frustratingly hard as that sometimes is, I wouldn't trade a minute of it for the world. I say that because Team Fortress 2 is genuinely one of the most fun experiences I've ever had with a video game, multiplayer or otherwise. I'm utterly terrible at most video games, but the fun I've had with TF2 makes me forget all of that, and just have fun with it. At its core, the game has a charm to me that's never even come close to dying out. I've met so many good friends and have so many accomplishments thanks to Team Fortress 2 that this one game has practically changed my entire life. And I'll love every minute of its past, present and future until the time the servers shut down; at which point, I will frame my collection as several large pictures, on each wall of my house, as a memento of time well spent.
game-hours: 7530.1
review: Team Fortress 2 (a.k.a. Trade Fortress 2, Hat Fortress 2, Promo Fortress 2, Team Fashionista 2, Team Freetress 2) is a class-based first-person hat collection simulator. Originally it was a faithful recreation of the original Quake and Half-Life mods, but has since evolved from its original design into a pointless virtual collect-a-thon where the player must collect every rare item they can by any means necessary, in order to inflate their ego and show off their E-peen. The original point of the game revolved around playing gamemodes, such as capturing the enemy intelligence, pushing a bomb to the enemy base, or controlling a whole map by Scout-rushing control points, although now all this became nothing more than a small minigame to pass the time with while you wait for more hats and as time went on, more weapons to magically drop into your inventory while doing  all on Achievement or Idle servers. 9.5/10 Overall 5/10 just for half the community being mann co store .

review: Would reccomend, no if's and's or but's. Team Fortress 2 is amazingly addictive, and I'm not just talking about the gameplay aspect. Whenever this game became F2P, the only reason not to get this game was not enough space on your harddrive, but even then I knew people who would buy a new harddrive just for this game. The shop aspect is so well implemented, and the crates are almost a lottery. There is no reason anyone should not have this game. game-hours: 2086.9
review: Octoberfest is the world's largest fair held annually in Munich, Bavaria, Germany. It is a 16-day festival running from late September to the first weekend in October with more than 6 million people from around the world attending the event every year. To the locals, it is not called Oktoberfest, but "die Wies'n", after the colloquial name of the fairgrounds (Theresienwiese) themselves. The Oktoberfest is an important part of Bavarian culture, having been held since 1810. Other cities across the world also hold Oktoberfest celebrations, modeled after the original Munich event. The Munich Oktoberfest originally took place during the sixteen days up to, and including, the first Sunday in October. In 1994, the schedule was modified in response to German reunification so that if the first Sunday in October falls on the 1st or 2nd, then the festival would go on until October 3 (German Unity Day). Thus, the festival is now 17 days when the first Sunday is October 2 and 18 days when it is October 1. In 2010, the festival lasted until the first Monday in October, to mark the anniversary of the event. The festival is held in an area named the Theresienwiese (field, or meadow, of Therese), often called Wiesn for short, located near Munich's center. Large quantities of Oktoberfest Beer are consumed, with almost 7 million litres served during the 16 day festival in 2007. Visitors may also enjoy a wide variety of traditional food such as Hendl (roast chicken), Schweinebraten (roast pork), Schweinshaxe (grilled ham hock), Steckerlfisch (grilled fish on a stick), Wrstl (sausages) along with Brezen (pretzel), Kndel (potato or bread dumplings), Ksesptzle (cheese noodles), Reiberdatschi (potato pancakes), Sauerkraut or Rotkohl/Blaukraut (red cabbage) along with such Bavarian delicacies as Obatzda (a spiced cheese-butter spread) and Weisswurst (a white sausage).

game-hours: 276.2
review: Epic Classic.
game-hours: 97.5
review: ElectronJake Score - "Highly addicting, a must play." Traditional Score - 9/10 To be honest, Team Fortress 2 does multiplayer first person shooters the right way. That's all it is. No campaign, no sugarcoating, just pure multiplayer goodness. A mulitude of game modes and servers makes it incredible fresh each time you play, and it's very much a community driven game. It also has 9 different classes to choose from, which I consider to be the highlight. Creating builds for these classes is awesome. I love how all the different play styles are DIFFERENT. Not everyone is run and gun, which is a positive for me. The game is truly a "team" game. No solo work. Each class is important in some way. And as I said earlier, the classes are extremely customizable. Each class has a primary, secondary,and melee weapon, though some have other things, such as the Engineer's buildings, or the Spy's stealth based moveset. The best part about TF2 is that it is free to play. PLUS it's free to play done right. You can pay for inventory items, which change up gameplay considerably, but they're not required. You can get plenty of weapons through random trades. A robust economy and trading system compliment what seems to be a barebones shooter. With a couple of friends, this game turns into massive fun.

review: TF2 is an exciting fun game with very good graphics, with nine distinct classes, scout (the fastest), soldier (the rocketman), pyro (the pyromaniac), demoman (the demolitonist), heavy (the heavyweaponsguy), engineer (the techincal defenseive builder), sniper (the hitman), medic (the healer), and spy (the invisible back-stabbing ninja). All of these classes balance out with each other, where one class is no more superior and lesser than another. Overall TF2 is a fun exciting game with 9 balanced out distinct classes, where world-wide players team up together, on two teams, (attack and defense), on different map gamemodes, to win against the other team. Their are also many cosmetics to choose from to make any class of your's look snazzy, fancy, hip, etc. Many different guns to try out for each class. I reccomend this game to FPS players, like COD, BF3, BF4, players, etc. who want to play something different for a change. Their also many taunts, like the newest one, THE CONGA!!!, also many killing taunts that u can enable to kill enemies. Their's one taunt you can use called the Kamikaze, where as a soldier, you can run-up to an enemy or a group and taunt, blowup killing you and possibly, the enemies around you. I definitely reccomend this game to people who like shooting, fast-paced, good graphics games!!!

review: Disregard everything that says it's Free to Play, because trust me, you are going to spend at least several AAA games worth of money buying keys, unboxing, getting pissed off you got a strange Crit-a-Cola instead of a shiny unusual, wising up, and using your keys to buy wonderous cosmetics so you can have a Soldier that looks like a drill sargeant or a racially offensive Demoman. Although these cosmetics don't have any impact on your play (according to Valve, at least; some believe they make you better at the game, myself included), they have an impact in the real world; you entering a dark downward spiral in which you feel obligated to spend all your dosh on pixels in the hopes someone on Gorge will tell you "nice hat". It's like a black hole in that once you enter, you can't turn back. Your life is forever ruined, and you are a hollow husk of your former self. It's a phenomenal experience, 10/10.

game-hours: 816.6
review: If you like combat games, I would heartily recommend this game. The integration of the different classes with their different strengths and weaknesses means that there is a class for everyone, be it a more directly offensive rule like the Heavy or Demoman, or more support-related like the Engineer or Medic. The game is not completely free to play, as there is a mode, Mann vs. Machine, where a purchase is required for participation, as well as a store where weapons and optional accessories (known by the collective term of "hats") can be purchased. These areas are, however, completely optional, and avoiding them detracts in no way from the main gameplay. EDIT: Thanks mozaux for pointing out Boot Camp. Yes, a free version even of MvM is available. However, it is true that you cannot gain rewards for this mode as you would in Mann Up mode, as the paid version is called.

review: This is a one-of-a-kind shooter with an incredible experience, it's sure to draw you in for 100s of hours as you fight, stomp, bite, shoot, snipe, kill, murder, and smash your way to victory (and 100s of collectable items!) The game features several modes where you (and your valuable team) fight to capture points, push carts, shoot zombies, break robots, steal intelligence, and set off rockets for sweet, sweet victory! Dislike the stock weapons? Pick from many, many extra weapons (and attachable killstreak modifiers) to bring with you into your battle for ultimate glory! (and bragging rights) If you dislike being a Free To Play player, you can simply buy an item from the mann-co store for as low as 50 cents (or 25 cents if they're having a sale), and instantly snag that oh-so-great UNLIMITED premium membership! You can pick from up to 9 classes, all with their own trailer, backstory, weapons and hats! Each character is much different than the other, and they're all balanced! All in all, it's a GREAT pick-up, and one of the best games on the Steam Shop! 10/10 And remember, medic is pie! (but please don't eat your medic, it will probably scare the rest of your team and make you sick)

game-hours: 164.1
review: Team Fortress 2 has the most balanced classes around with some being more for new players and others being for the more experienced. Take the sniper. The sniper is the easiest class in the game and it is extremely easy to use. It is recommended to try and shoot the body and not the head, as it does almost the same amount of damage. The pyro however, is almost impossible to master and the people who are able to use it well have been called w+m1-ers. This stands for win+medic1, because a pyro and a medic are almost unstoppable and can win the game if the pyro has any decent amount of skill. The heavy is also one of the harder class, and the win+medic1 also applies to it. There are many great game modes and maps, but I love deathmatch on 2fort myself.

game-hours: 656.4
review: Team Fortress 2 is easily one of the best Free to play's on the market. The gameplay is extremely balanced with 9 unique classes all specialized for their roles. The loadouts are all balanced with the stock weapons being the most reliable to keep newcomers at the same level as others, so not pay 2 win aspect at all, something this game prides in. You instead recieve weapons from random drops and can craft them with other in game items. Money is instead spent on non-gameplay changing cosmetics and weapons with special rarities. There is also always a constantly large population of people always playing, so dont worry about not being able to find a server with people playing. The community has also had a large affect on the game. There have been several maps, cosmetic items, and other items from the community that have been added into the game. The gameplay is also very addicting, with 9 unique classes, you'll find something that will fit your play style. It is very different from other shooters so prepare to adapt. Overall, TF2 is one of the best multiplayer FPS experiences I have ever played.

Final verdict: Great game. Just try not to get sucked into the world of hats (although it's inevitable).

review: I have to say, Team Fortress 2 is one of the very few shooters that I enjoy. I have been playing for over a year now and the game offers a lot of action, humor and fun! And of course, let's not forget the hats, NEVER forget the hats. In my opinion, they need to make a few weapons better. For example, the Quick-Fix; a medi gun that heals very quickly, but only over-heals you about 50% while other medi guns heal about 125%, seems like a good combination right? Problem is its bercharge does not make you invunerable or gives you critical hits, it only heals even quicker. What I think they should do for the bercharge is it should last even longer than the normal bercharge. Overall, this game is fun to enjoy and play with friends. I highly recommend this game.

review: There's nothing better.
game-hours: 250.4
review: Ok: To the point. This game, in all it's glory, is a class-based shooter game with challenging achievements, creative maps, and intresting classes with excellant voice-acting. However, if you really want to be good at this game and develop a high amount of skill, don't expect that to come easily. This ain't CoD, alright? There are STATS, that MATTER, and CAN COMPLETELY RUIN THE GAME if you aren't going to, you guessed it, REEEEEEEAAAAAAD! It isn't hard! Take some time and figure out the diffrance between the Classic, The Original, and the Bottle! Albeit a free game, if you want to be good, then you'd better save up your money for some weapons. If you want respect, buy some cosmetics. (NOTE: The Ghostly Gibus DOESN'T COUNT, and neither do the Pyrovision Goggles, which are achievement items.) All in all, a challenging game that took a step away from the normal shooter that truely was a beautiful creation that i reccomend to anyone with the patience to play.

game-hours: 65.3
review: great graphics. fun to play.
game-hours: 4070.4
review: A very unique class based shooter with 9 classes that each fulfills their jobs really well and is considered the WoW of team based shooters Pros: . From a competitive standpoint almost all of the free weapons are THE BEST (certain melee fall behind like bonesaw to ubersaw) . A Very Active Community at the time of writing this review (with a community made update and another major valve down the road) . Modded Game modes that run from slenderman to a form of juggernaught from Halo . Tons of customization options allowed to people who are premium (with high tier rare hats worth up to 1000s of dollars) . Has a PVE game mode called Mann vs Machine (warning since its pve the eliteists hide here on special MVM servers proceed with experience and caution) . Weapons randomly drop while playing that are the same ones you buy from the store and you can trade for them if you are premium so theres no real pay to win . A unique cartoony artstyle that makes it hard to look old ish . Has a highish skill ceiling for people who want to take apart every part of their class or game to maximize their potential Cons . Some of the weapons ARE better than the stock free weapons like the ubersaw for medic (as a medic main I cant leave it behind) . As with all shooters you will meet the #getrekt420blazeit . If you are a realism person this game is probably not for you in terms of artstyle or gameplay . Some weapons dont actively tell you all the secrets about them unless you find out or are told (Flare gun crits on burning people and this is not on its item description) . Has a relatively high skill ceiling with unique tricks to certain classes like rocket pogo and sticky pogo and how to fully control your flying through the air for maximum damage or placement if you are not into that . Since TF2 is sometimes called the hat based shooter you may recieve criticism on being unhatted at first and potentially called a hacker for dominating people as a precision hitscan class like sniper

review: Team Fortress 2... one of the best multiplayer games i've ever played and that's impressive considering it's a shooter. The 9 different classes and an entire armory of weapons keeps the gameplay and variety flowing. This game was released in 2007 and it's still relevant today which is impressive for today's standards. Not to mention the chat which is always a good thing. Each class is unique with their own playstyles and abilities with weapons that cater to one playstyle or another. There is an assortment of different maps and gamemodes, all of them unique and fun to play. There's also hats which you can collect and wear for no purpose other then looking good. These hats are all different and you will always find a hat that you like. The graphics are wonderfully cartoony, being based off of early 21st century artists like Norman Rockwell. Each character has their own unique charming personalities, suiting them well and making them more funny with their quotes. Overall, i think Team Fortress 2 is a great multiplayer game having both excellent gameplay and funny charm. I give this game 10/10
game-hours: 1312.0
review: How to Properly Play the Game Step 1: Do nothing Step 2: Once you did nothing for about 50 hours, you will earn a hat Step 3: Jump onto a trade server Step 4: As you connect yourself to the server, brace yourself for sprays that are not suitable for minors Step 5: Ignore the Rainbow Dash booty call spray and type in chat "Selling hat" Step 6: Once you accepted his/her trade, crush their soul and steal their hats Step 7: Once you have crushed enough souls, you will become rich Step 8: Amass your wealth to get an Unusual, which is an amalgamation of pixels floating around the hat Step 9: Play the shooting mini-game that comes along with Hat Simulator 2, and get beaten in a gunfight against a free to play person wearing an achievement hat Step 10: Punch a hole through your computer and hang yourself

game-hours: 334.1
review: Team Fortress 2 is a free to play class-based game with 9 classes. These classes include Scout, Soldier, Pyro, Demoman, Heavy, Engineer, Medic, Sniper and spy. Each class has its won unique play style and weaponry. All the classes loadout consist of a primary weapon, secondary weapon and melee weapon. There is also weapons you can find by playing the game. There is also hats you can find,make or buy. If you are planning on buying a hat i recommend buying them on the community market which may be for a cheaper price. You can also buy weapons on the community market that arent normal weapons instead they are strange, killstreaking, botkillers and festive even though they are different than the normal weapons they sell for less than the store on tf2 (note this dosent apply for all weapons). I recommend not to buy anything untill you are sure you like tf2 and you will be playing for a while. This is a great game to play with friends to be competitive or goof around . This happens to be the game me and my friends play together the most we really like to join games with no one in them and play eacother. It is also a advantage to have a friend who plays tf2 cause you can trade wit hthen and you can give them a weapon you dont want but they do and they can give you one they dont want. You could also count on a good deal with trades from a friend. There is many game modes in tf2. These game modes are Control points, King of the Hill, Special delivery, Payload, Payload race, Capture the flag and Attack/Defence. Each game mode has a different objective than the others. Attack/denfence is my favorite. Each game mode takes skill to master. Im not even that good at all the game modes or the game in general yet. Thats all i have to say about this great game for now but i may edit it and add more so keep your eyes open. ~nobel~

game-hours: 66.3
review: Team Fortress 2 is the most realistic hat simulator created to date. There is absolutely no other simulator quite like this one. The first time you start the simulator, you join a server where you can play a minigame where you show off your hats and items. If you kill a person three times in a row in the minigame, you get your very first hat: the Gibus. This is where it really starts; To play the simulator correctly, you have to spend money in the market place, made by Valve. After that, while you play the minigame, you can find hats which you can trade for, or collect! There is many other people who wants to collect and trade hats, just like you! After you collect enough items and/or hats, try joining a trade server! There, the REAL fun begins! Good luck, and beware of ending up poor!

game-hours: 928.6
review: Team Fortress 2 Is literally my favorite game of all time. This game is great for free to plays and pay to plays. For free to plays, you have stock weapons which are actually very balanced, and with the drop system you can get any weapon with different stats, (ecxept reskins and hats and misc. But they do matter in terms of stats.) You can play against a pay to play and win, because it's really about skill and experience. Where the game shines is really in it's community. Most people are generally ecxepting of noobs. Mainly because the game features so many silly things to play around with. It's also refreshing from your average realistic military fps. I personally like the sort of cartoony artstyle of the game. There's so much I'm leaving out about this game, but if this is reason enough for you to buy it, you're crazy! It's free god dammit!

review: One of the Greatest Games Ever Made. An FPS that is like no other FPS you have ever played, or you will ever play. And if you have a steam account, you have to play TF2 at least once. It's an initiation. It has a relatively shallow learning curve and is friendly to players of all skill levels. The first match I ever played on were on Skial servers... and I didn't get THAT torn apart. But trust me, scrub or superb, this game has a place for you. But it is not for the faint hearted... Nah, that is incorrect. If you are god awful at Call of Duty, then play this game; you will be good. If you are an M.L.G. Pro level C.o.D. player, stay away. This game will blow your mind with all its non-fps-like nuances. I recommend this game with the all my heart... what ever is left of it after... review: My Opinion: TF2 is a really interesting game with a creative cartoon style and some fast-paced gameplay. Each class has different tactics than the other, and you have to figure out how to overcome the oppenent's strategies. As I mentioned previously, the art style is really cool, and the classes have their own personalities to boot. The inventory/loadout system is also convenient - You choose how you play each class. The only problems that I see are a couple of "bad egg" players and small children who should be elsewhere. But hey, Valve added both a report AND a mute button! For free? Definitely get this game.

game-hours: 217.1
review: One of the first pictorial depictions of a hat appears in a Thebes tomb painting which shows a man wearing a conical straw hat. Other early hats were the Pileus, a simple skull cap; the Phrygian cap, worn by freed slaves in Greece and Rome; and the Greek petasos, the first known hat with a brim. Women wore veils, kerchiefs, hoods, caps and wimples. St. Clement, the patron saint of felt hatmakers, is said to have discovered wool felt when he filled his sandals with flax fibers to protect his feet.[4] In the Middle Ages, hats were a marker of social status and used to single out certain groups. The 1215 Fourth Council of the Lateran required that all Jews identify themselves by wearing the Judenhat (Jewish hat), marking them as targets for anti-Semitism.[5]The hats were usually yellow, and were either pointed or square. [6] In the Middle Ages, hats for women ranged from simple scarves to elaborate hennin,[7] and denoted social status. Structured hats for women similar to those of male courtiers began to be worn in the late 16th century.[8] The term milliner comes from the Italian city of Milan, where the best quality hats were made in the 18th century. Millinery was traditionally a womans occupation, with the milliner not only creating hats and bonnets but also choosing lace, trimmings and accessories to complete an outfit.[9] Men's hat, 1600-1625 In the first half of the 19th century, women wore bonnets that gradually became larger, decorated with ribbons, flowers, feathers, and gauze trims. By the end of the century, many other styles were introduced, among them hats with wide brims and flat crowns, the flower pot and the toque. By the middle of the 1920s, when women began to cut their hair short, they chose hats that hugged the head like a helmet.[8] The tradition of wearing hats to horse racing events began at the Royal Ascot in Britain, which maintains a strict dress code. All guests in the Royal Enclosure must wear hats.[10] This tradition was adopted at other horse racing events, such as the Kentucky Derby in the United States.[11] Extravagant hats were popular in the 1980s, and in the early 21st century, flamboyant hats made a comeback, with a new wave of competitive young milliners designing creations that include turban caps, trompe-l'oeil-effect felt hats and tall headpieces made of human hair. Some new hat collections have been described as "wearable sculpture." Many pop stars, among them Lady Gaga, have commissioned hats as publicity stunts.[12]

review: This game has been around for almost 7 years might go for it's tenth year and I could see why. What I like about this game is how well it's balanced, not just in weapons but in the classes themselves. Every class and its gun has its up and downs. No sense of it being a "pay-to-win" game. Cheapest gun is low as 0.49 cents and as I said before alot of the guns are fairly balanced. Oh yeah you can't forget about the hats... hats hats HATS!!!!! You can customize your charactor with whatever apperal or hats. Whether you wanna make look badass or just flat out stupid the choices are yours. Some people could say that hats are killing the games. Alot of the updates has just HATS and it could be annoying, buts the hat could go either way. The hats has open up a new world for tf2 but there is more hats then there is guns. But I could see why it's pretty hard to make a gun that is fairly balanced. So I would say this game gats a 9/10

review: The best multiplayer experience you can get!
game-hours: 1450.2
review: Team Fortress 2 is, dare I say, one of the most innovative FPS games of all time. With nine different classes to choose from and battle with other online users head on in different game modes, the combinations are endless. The graphics of this game are somewhat simple, but stylized in such a way that reminds me of a comic book, which is very appealing. Being able to customize your loadout and collect hats, miscs, taunts, etc. the possibilities are endless. The community is also a competitive group of people, all around the world going for the top of the scoreboard, or the community that strives to get that one certain hat, and have the richest backpack. Now, a few downsides would be some of the exploitable bugs, but that's not too big of a deal. Valve is very good with fixing the bugs found nowadays. The annoying downtimes from item servers can be an annoyance as well, but aside from those few things it is overshadowed by Team Fortress 2's greatness. With more being added frequently, the involvement with the community, and addicting gameplay, TF2 is given a solid 9.5/10

review: There's a point where I can write a review that can be both amazing yet bias at the same time; I hope I don't try to influence anyone by this review alone. When I first got Team Fortress 2, it was an experience that can't be beat. This first-person shooter can't go to say that this is probably the greatest in gaming history. From trading to crafting, this game will keep you on th edge of your seat until you know it's ready to stop playing. There are 9 classes, each that is unique and makes the game fairly balanced, making th game experience even more fun. With all the updates, there are some positive and negative effects than can affect the Team Fortress 2 trading community as a whole, but the whole aspect is to game, have fun, and enjoy your time on this game. It's your decision to buy from the store. It's your decision to craft metal and hats. It's your decision to play, idle, or even be a teammate and balance the rosters. The community is just like this game: random. So if you wish to stop playing other FPS titles and take a break from imbalanced games, then your choice is this: you won't be dissapointed.

game-hours: 1482.7
review: This game is really wonderful, and it does so many things RIGHT. Playing is free, updates are free, and even weapons will simply drop with enough playtime! Hats, though useless in gameplay, are a game in and of itself. You can find yourself in trading servers scrapbanking for minor profits to save for that one misc that will finish your outfit. The one rule is simple: You either stop playing when you are still F2P, or you find yourself becoming P2P. There are a few exceptions that have made a virtual fortune on a free-to-play account, and those people have more dedication to TF2 than the people that are P2P. I highly recommend this game. It is free in all the good ways and does not limit the powers or weapons of F2P players. Pay to win does NOT go in Tf2 ! Some servers that are hosted by outsider parties have premium accounts that can be bought that will boost your damage and health, but the valve servers are clean from this. The community is never ending and the updates keep coming in. Come to take a look- die a few hundred times, and maybe in a year you'll find yourself jolting awake- a hundred hats in your backpack and a "Hale's own" ranking on your kill-counting weapons!

game-hours: 688.0
review: Team Fortress 2 is a first-person shooter and Gaben-conomy simulator. It has a moderately-sized player base, filled with a few different kinds of people. Some include: ** Nooblings asking for free items. I kid you not, this can be a nuisance when playing sometimes. ** Map-makers/editors (Otherwise known as mappers) and people that modify the game's server software to create new game modes or additions to the game (modders). Also, there are modellers, people that create and submit assets to the Workshop for consideration to be included in the game. ** Team-spirited people. There are a few game modes, the most popular being Control Points (defend control points from capture by the attacking team), Capture the Flag, Payload (deliver a bomb cart to the other team) and Mann vs Machine (6 players versus robots of varying class that arrive in waves). In most of TF2's game modes, there are nine different types of mercenary to kill or be killed as. (Most people know these as classes) The only exception is Mann vs Machine mode, where you fight robot versions of these mercenaries. However, the most popular feature of TF2 is the economy. Introduced in 2010, it relies heavily on Steam's trading service. Most items traded are hats or metal. Hat trades are serious business for some people, with sites such as TF2Outpost set up to co-ordinate trades, and some items also have real-world value, so these sites often allow users to trade items for USD/Bitcoins/<currency goes here> or Steam games.

review: Team Fortress 2 (TF2) is the sequel to the game that put class-based, multiplayer team warfare on the map. TF2 delivers new gametypes, a signature art style powered by Valves next generation animation technology, persistent player statistics, and more. Unlike other "class-based" games that offer a variety of combat classes only, Team Fortress 2 packs a wild variety of classes which provide a broad range of tactical abilities and personalities, and lend themselves to a variety of player skills. Play as the flame-throwing Pyro, the room clearing Heavy, or the Spy, a master of disguises. Other classes include: Scout, Sniper, Medic, Engineer, Demoman, or Soldier. TF2 features the most advanced graphics of any Source-based game released to date  and the most exciting class-based action ever created. [Valve]

review: Great game with good content there are such a large choice of hats for each character, special qualitys and effects. personally, i do not really like the pvp as much as games like counter strike but the thing that i like the most is the Mann vs Machine game mode. i've already done 23 tours in its mann up mode for the two cities tour and although i havent have much success with loot(only 1 professional killstreak and no australium) i really feel that its worth the money the few thing that i would like to change/add to the game is firstly a feature to be matched with at least 3-4 players with the same/more tours as you with an exception of 1-2 newer players. also for the votekick system in mvm, the kicker should fill in a report for why they are kicking the player and if there is no reason, the kicker will get a bad rep in mvm, and i think there should be a reputation system for the mvm game mode to see the team play and manners of a certain player. another thing i dont like is that many of the servers are not within my area and i get a ping of 200+ in mvm. i also feel that tf2 is slightly broken after one of the updates (i dont really know which). i have a high fps and in some servers, a low ping but either way, my game still stutters alot and occassionally freezes. when i first started tf2, thats how the gamewas like for me but for at least 320 hours of my gameplay was very smooth. then the stuttering returned and now its very hard to enjoy the game like i'd always had. so i really hope that valve can fix it. tf2 is a great game to get and become premnium (its really cheap to be one). it has humour and really  physics. if you are a fan of pvp or co-op games, tf2 is definitely a game you should get and be premnium at. i hope valve wont release a sequel but rather continue to update the game and when source 2 engine comes, upgrade tf2 to source 2.

game-hours: 1344.9
review: You probably know what this game is. Lets be honest, everyone has probably heard of Team Fortress 2 the moment they got on steam. Team Fortress 2 is a free-to-play shooter with a cartoony art style, and an unusual way of playing that sets it apart from other shooters. In Team Fortress 2, there are 9 classes, each with its weaknesses and advantages. Along with the basic shooting, classes have their own unique abilities that help on the battlefield. However, this game is not only famous for the click & shoot, it has one of the most interesting (and complicated) economy that I enjoy to participate in. You can work your way up to be able trade in-game items for actual steam games. This game also doesn't tax your machine and even on low settings is lovable with it's computer-friendly artstyle. Even though it's been released a long time ago, Team Fortress 2 still maintains it's freshness and uniqueness.

review: This game is truly a remarkable piece of art. Though the graphics arent on par with many other games it is fit fit with the mood and the general tone of the game. The game mechanics are simple and easy to get used too however each character possess unique and indivisual characters making it diffucult to master all the classes at once but it does allow you to gravitate towards the different classes that bes suit your personality. No matter how good his game maybe you do often see times where you rage due to lack of inexperience or.... pyros. Yes, I said pyros, this is because it is one of the most op classes if used correctly and it is the easiest one to master. this is evident in the Valve servers where there were many newbs like me but only the pyros ranked at the top with a staggering amount of kills. Another downside to this game is the auto-balance system because usually the teams are never balanced in a way that would give room for growth and the level of the players competeing would be equal. and if you especially were playing with friends on the same team autobalance can mess up the flow. Overall this game was ingenious and something i definitely reccomend this game and I hope that if you give this game a chance that you are able to enjoy it as much as I did.

game-hours: 661.6
review: Team Fortress 2 has to be my favourite game. It has variety, with nine very different classes, a huge range of strange and very entertaining weapons and a decent amount of gamemodes, ranging from melee-only Medieval mode to the classic Control Points and Payload modes. It also recieves regular, if a little hat-obsessed, updates from Valve with things like new maps, weapons and cosmetics (your wallet's worst enemy). This combined with events such as Halloween, Smissmas and TF2's own birthday amounts to a hugely diverse shooter. I've noticed a lot of complaints about the amount of cosmetics and other items that require the spending of real money (stranges, Mann Up rewards, taunts, etc.) entering TF2 lately. But these aren't really game-changing at all. All are purely for looks (any new weapons can be found in a drop, crafted or traded for), making TF2 not pay2win at all. Not many F2P games can make that claim, so we should be grateful that (for now) Valve are not making us pay obscene amounts of cash to have a good time. All in all, you should give this game a go. Even if you are terrible at FPS games (like me) and have a pretty low-grade PC (also like me) I really do urge you to try it out. Chances are you will not regret it. And remember: The Gibus is not an indication of skill. It just means the player was sensible enough to not spend their money on virtual attire.

game-hours: 364.6
review: Team Fortress 2 is a game based around teamwork as the name suggests. You choose from a choice of 9 very different classes all with their own advantages and disadvantages. At the time of this review there are a large variety of different modes that you can play. King of the Hill, Control Points, Capture the Flag, and more. There is also a co-op mode called Mann vs. Machine where you team up with 5 or so other players and proceed to beat the living crap (or not so living in this case) out of a large volume of robots whose designs and weapons are based around the nine classes. The game also has an enormous amount of cosmetic items added into the game as well as different weapon choices for each class. Most, if not all, of the weapons can be obtained within the game just by playing for an extended amount of time. Cosmetics such as hats or outfits can also be recieved as drops, but the chances are much smaller and you may be better off trading for one you want or buying it within the in-game store. Every year there are always updates and events (many around halloween) that are always different and exciting in their own way, so it keeps the game fresh and a blast to play with some close friends. Now since the game is free I would say to anyone who has not played it before, go play it even if it's only for a few minutes to see why it came to be so popular; you may end up liking it. Grab a rocket launcher or a sniper rifle and go have yourself a good time.

game-hours: 502.5
review: Where do I begin. Being someone who came from a game like Battlefield, a game I ended up getting great at. This was a totally new playing field for me. I was used to like 4 classes, their are 9 in this game. All with their own strengths, weaknesses, and amazingly well written personalities. This game very quickly became the most fun I've had in a virtual world. Even if you don't win you're gonna have fun, because honestly what other game has american vets shooting rockets at their feet and landing on people's faces while at the same time smacking them with a frying pan!? It's highly entertaining! Pros- All the classes are useful, and highly situational A fun loving community, that is all about goofing off Hats to give your classes a hint of your own personality and taste Several weapons that take time to learn how to use correctly Each class has an entertaining personality, and something funny to say While this game is goofy as can be, it can be highly intense Graphics that are very art inspired, thus making them fun to look at Multiple gamemodes so that the fun never stops It never gets repetitive, something new will happen everytime you jump into a match A great soundtrack A very cool secret agent kind of feel, this game takes place in 1972, but has technology that we don't even have to this day, which makes for a really sci-fi-ish feel. Cons- Occasional bugs, but every game has these Some community members can be very hateful, like telling free to plays that they are worthless, or telling members of fandom groups that they need to kill themselves, however you can't find any perfect community Two cons? That's it yeah. I honestly can't find anything else negative to say. I got this game way back in January 31st, 2014. I had always wanted it since 2010 but wasn't able to get myself a computer (Mac OSX Air) once I did I played the crap out of this game, and I still play it an insane amount of time, I wanna be a writer, but everytime I get on here to write something I end up starting up Team Fortress 2. Regardless I'll write my book at some point. In closing, thanks to Law Abiding Engineer for giving me tips back when I had only 10 hours logged. GG Valve, your games are legendary.

review: This is only shooting game I have. . . and probably the only shooting game I'll ever own. It's so good that I don't need other shooting games to quench the killer thirst within me. . . hehe.
